metadata.title: CVE-2021-45960 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
In Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3, a left shift by 29 (or more) placesin the storeAtts function in xmlparse.c can lead to realloc misbehavior(e.g., allocating too few bytes, or only freeing memory).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.3-1
libexpat1 - 2.4.3-1
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.3-1').
xmlrpc-c package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
